sub_title: Marketing Communications Advisor | Strategy | Branding | Multichannel
summary:
Marketing and Communication expertise and project management skills with a wide range of international working experience. Entrepreneurial and hands-on. No-nonsense. Targets always ahead. Helping companies in getting awareness and conversion into quality leads.  Developed communication strategies and go-to-market tactics. Clear multi-channel communication and data driven marketing. Pioneered, developed and finetuned social media strategies.  Specialized in public-private-partnership communication, communitybuilding and funding.

As a marketing and communications expert and trainer I boost the teamspirit with enthusiasm and tailor-made workshops leading to happy customers and happy employees. If you need a passionate, creative and enthusiastic marcom person with allround expertise. Let's talk:
drs. Else Embregts
 +31 (0)6 436 122 91
 e.embregts@claraklooster.nl

treasury_media.title: EIT Digital' Fit to Perform Tachograph of tomorrow (link to video)
treasury_media.description:
Fit 2 Perform will deliver the tachograph of tomorrow making professional driving safer, healthier and more efficient. It brings the vital body signs (like activity, stress, sleep, ...) of the driver into the fleet management systems next to the vehicle operation data (like acceleration, breaking, steering, ...)
Link to the video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yPrdPZHlYjg

projects.title: Launch of the online education programme 'Internet of things through embedded systems'
projects.description: EIT Digital is launching online courses on the Coursera platform because it supports Coursera’s bold vision to enable anyone, anywhere, to transform their lives by accessing the world’s best learning experience. The Eindhoven University of Technology is the coordinator of this project. Creating awareness on the first courses that were going to be published was necessary as we are a newcomer in the field. I have created a booklet and deployed a modest digital marketing campaign. Result: 45.000 visitors and 17.533 active learners.

Event took place in April 2016, in Brussels and lasted 3 days. Between the 500-600 visitors attended. Exhibition had to be build up from scratch: concept to realisation, including all the marketing tools, for all the exhibitors. Time to operate this all: 3 months. Very challenging. The reward was that the event was a huge success. Mission impossible, accomplished,

profile_positions.description:
Currently I am active as advisor and trainer social media within SKAP. I am responsible for the digital marketing and content management and support the campaigns and funding actions. Following the UN sustainable development goal 6, SKAP feels the moral duty to make clean water and sanitation feasible for everyone. 

Call me: 00 31 (0)6 436 122 91 if you need a dedicated marcoms person with allround expertise.
Such as:
•	defining communications strategies and go-to-market tactics
• 	training your teams to balance identity and image of your company
•	engaging closely with international teams ensuring buy-in
•	developing workshops on mission - vision - strategy
• 	create engaging communications (newsletters, emails, social content, articles, blogs)
•	setting up and roll out your social media strategy and content calendar
•	working with various outside agencies as required

Drop a line: 00 31 (0)6 436 122 91. We grab a coffee and explore the match.
profile_positions.title: Strategic marketing and communications specialist

profile_positions.description:
HAN University of Applied Sciences is a leading university of applied sciences in the Netherlands. From its campuses in Arnhem and Nijmegen, 3,500 staff members provide education to 35,000 students in almost 80 Bachelors and Masters courses.  As an international advisor I am mainly responsible for the recruitment strategy of students and communication to the external and internal stakeholders. Next to this I am developing the digital marketing and social media strategy for HAN's international ambition to prepare students for a fast changing global world.
As an Euregional educator in the Euregio Arnhem-Nijmegen and Nord Rhein Westfalen, HAN is actively operating in the knowledge triangle Education-Research-Business. And I am in! Want to know more? Mail me: else.embregts@han.nl
profile_positions.title: International Marketing and Communication Advisor

profile_positions.location: Eindhoven / Berlin / London / Stockholm / Helsinki / Paris / Trento
profile_positions.description:
EIT Digital, Bringing ICT Innovations to Life

In  2012, I  started working in the marketing communications for EIT Digital Eindhoven at the High Tech Campus, the Netherlands. I loved working with project members, students, entrepreneurs, SMEs and startups as well as major industrial partners.  Together with an awesome team, I realised the implementation of communications strategy and successful social media. Next to this, I could make a difference as linking pin between European locations, driving campaigns and projects; addressing targets.  I loved working together, trouble shooting and coordinating international teams. Organising large scale events from A-Z next to small-scale workshops and startup meetups creating leads & deals & press visibility. Now, the goals are sharpened and the ground work has been done. I move on. Feel free to contact me anytime and let us explore the possibilities for cooperation.

The EIT Digital community is a collaboration of Large Enterprises, Universities and Knowledge centres with locations around Europe: London, Helsinki, Paris, Stockholm, Berlin, Trento, Madrid, Budapest, Eindhoven and a hub in Silicon Valley. The organisation is one of the first Knowledge and Innovation Communities of the European Institute of Technology. 

EIT Digital aims to create a new breed of innovators and entrepreneurs that can develop breakthrough ideas - supported all the way to the market. To realise this aim, Education, Research and Business are key in the EIT Digital approach. Since 2010, EIT Digital has consistently mobilised talents, ideas, technologies, investments as well as business across Europe and beyond. I was lucky to deliver my share in this dynamic process. Thanks to all the bright and gifted  EIT Digital Master School students. It was an honour to work with them and to coach them from out of the Co-location Centre Eindhoven.
profile_positions.title: Marketing Communications Manager

company.name: ARTEMIS, Advanced Research & Technology for EMbedded Intelligence and Systems

profile_positions.company: ARTEMIS, Advanced Research & Technology for EMbedded Intelligence and Systems
profile_positions.description:
Almost 5 years, I have worked as Manager Marketing Communications for ARTEMIS in Europe. ARTEMIS is an acronym for Advanced Research & Technology for EMbedded Intelligence and Systems and it is the name of an innovation programme to boost collaborative research in embedded systems at pan-European level. My work for ARTEMIS is played out in the world of funding for the R&D and innovation of embedded computing systems: in a European context with significant political impact.
Within ARTEMIS, three stakeholders work together: the European Commission, the industry as represented by the ARTEMIS Industry Association and 23 European member states. The Industry Association is the private partner in this type of joint ventures called ARTEMIS Joint Undertaking. The ARTEMIS Joint Undertaking  is headquartered in Brussels and is a so called Public Private Partnership of the stakeholders. The ARTEMIS Industry Association is headquarterd in Eindhoven and represents an influential network of more than 200 members (LEs, SMEs, ROs).  Each year untill 2013 the ARTEMIS Joint Undertaking launches the annual Calls for innovation in embedded systems. 

I am looking back to some wonderful and fruitful ARTEMIS years. Together with a hard working team, we have brought the ambitious R&D&I goals closer to reality for the benefit of European citizens.

Go for more info to: http://www.artemis-ia.eu
profile_positions.title: Manager Marketing Communications & Productmanager

profile_positions.description: The Communications unit of Bouwgenius Holding was specialised in the marketing of real estate projects for its customers. I was mainly responsible for the strategy and support of the pitches together with the Commercial Director. Result: winning of the Hoedemakers pitch for selling real estate in Deuteren.
profile_positions.title: Manager Marketing Communications projectbasis

profile_positions.description:
Working at Holst Centre, High Tech Campus Eindhoven, was one of the most exciting interim projects to deal with. The branding of Holst Centre, setting the basis for the communications department and to create visibility for the WATS and SIF technology were my focus. The inauguration of the new company building was the catalyst to introduce Holst Centre to the ecosystem. 
Therefore I organised and coordinated a research exhibition from scratch. All the innovation lines were branded: about 13 top notch projects with their demonstrators were selected. The presentation and exposure of each project was designed to the smallest detail (artist impressions, posters, powerpoint, stand-pitch, look&feel of every stand, dress code). Merely 90% of the invitees attended the vibrant event (325+ pax). High level policy makers, Belgian and Dutch Ministers of Economic Affairs, were welcomed and they sustained on the spot, the collaboration with the inauguration of the building. PR visibility accomplished.

Last but not least: the corporate Identity gift was a book 'Roads into the Future'. This is still an example of a marcom instrument which is able to envisage and translate a quite complex technology and visionary message into an attractive, interesting and understandable marcom tool for a broad audience. Interesting to know: a Taiwanese stakeholder published the book in Chinese.

volunteer_experiences.description: 2017-to date: organising and chairing of round table meetings. Goal: women empowerment

2007-2010: Treasurer of a residents association consisting of 75 appartments in a historical builidng in the city of 's-Hertogenbosch. Budget management and approval, annual financial report responsibility.

SKAP is a Dutch certified association of engaged people who feel the moral duty to make clean water and sanitation feasible for everyone. Drilling of waterholes, helping people to get access to clean water. To start with the poorest on earth, in the hottest and dry areas we know. 

I am responsible for the digital marketing and content management and support the campaigns and funding actions with social media.
As a Chairperson of this Student Association I was responsible for the political agenda and deployment of actions for the benefit and wellbeing of Students.
